flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Aircraft painting generates high concentrations of flammable vapours. Treat the painting area as a spray-application environment: strict ignition control, disciplined solvent handling, and effective ventilation are essential to prevent flash fire/explosion.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Electrical installations and temporary equipment within painting areas must be suitable for flammable vapour atmospheres. Non-suitable equipment and poor maintenance are common ignition pathways.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Ventilation and spray support systems are process-critical. Loss of extraction or interlocks can rapidly increase vapour accumulation risk and force an unsafe shutdown.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Large hangar openings and lightweight envelopes can be vulnerable to wind and wind-driven rain. Confirm storm procedures, door management, and securing/anchoring arrangements where applicable.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Emergency procedures should cover vapour ignition, spill response, safe shutdown, and protecting aircraft/assets during an incident.

high_energy_materials_control.help_text: Molten aluminium operations can escalate rapidly following loss of containment, refractory degradation, or loss of control. Confirm spill routes, containment capacity, and that water is controlled away from molten pathways.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Power reliability is critical for controlled operation and orderly shutdown. Loss of power can create severe equipment damage and difficult recovery; confirm redundancy and emergency arrangements.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Core process assets (pots/furnaces/casting/rolling) require disciplined inspection and monitoring. Confirm condition monitoring, maintenance planning, and critical spares for bottlenecks.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Hydraulic fluids, lubricants, and coatings can create severe fire exposures near hot equipment. Confirm leak control, less flammable fluids where appropriate, and effective local protection/segregation.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Emergency planning should include molten spill response, loss of utilities response, and recovery sequencing for critical equipment.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Loss potential is typically driven by process incidents more than natural hazards; still confirm site-specific exposure and utility resilience.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Press integrity is central to production. Confirm preventive maintenance, alignment checks, load limiting, condition monitoring, and life-assessment practices to prevent sudden failures and long outages.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Electrical failures stop presses and handling systems immediately. Confirm inspection/testing, condition monitoring, and that changes in load are managed with upgrades where required.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Flammable liquid exposures exist (e.g., lubricants/hydraulics) but are generally secondary to mechanical/electrical drivers. Confirm ignition controls and leak management.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Flooding of basements or floor-mounted electrical systems can cause severe business interruption. Confirm flood resilience, drainage, protection of critical rooms, and response capability.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Contingency planning should cover press failure, electrical outage, and recovery with critical spares and safe restart procedures.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Robotics and automated handling are core to body production. Confirm protection of control cabinets, spares strategy, program backups, and recovery plans for key bottlenecks.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: High electrical dependency means even short outages can stop production. Confirm electrical condition monitoring and resilience for critical systems.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Ignition sources (hot work, maintenance) and localized flammables can initiate fires. Confirm robust hot work controls, electrical maintenance, and housekeeping.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Flood and severe weather can drive major interruption. Confirm protection of floor/below-grade electrical areas, storm readiness, and site access/egress resilience.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Business continuity should address rapid restoration of automation capability, electrical recovery, and alternate production/logistics options.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Assembly lines are highly interdependent. Confirm reliability of automation/controls, availability of spares, and contingency plans for bottleneck equipment.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Electrical and control reliability is critical for continuous operation. Confirm maintenance, monitoring, and management of changes in loading and protection settings.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Fueling/finishing and localized processes introduce flammable liquid risk. Confirm shutoffs, spill control, drainage/containment, and ignition control during maintenance/hot work.

process_control_and_stability.help_text: Control of in-process storage (including plastics), housekeeping, and storage arrangements reduces fire spread and operational disruption.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Flood, wind, and hail can create major interruption and high-value damage (including yard/finished goods). Confirm resilience measures and response capability.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Continuity planning should account for supply chain fragility, alternate logistics routes, and rapid restoration after utility disruption.

process_safety_management.help_text: Process safety management is foundational: hazard reviews, management of change, operating discipline, training, audits, and closure of findings prevent escalation.

process_control_and_stability.help_text: Stable operation within defined safe limits is essential. Confirm procedures for normal/upset conditions, alarms, and operator response expectations.

safety_and_control_systems.help_text: Safety-critical instrumentation and shutdown functions must be designed, tested, and maintained to perform under abnormal conditions.

high_energy_process_equipment.help_text: Fired heaters and other high-energy equipment concentrate ignition/escalation risk. Confirm interlocks, trips, inspection regimes, and safe isolation.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Loss of containment can lead to fire/explosion/toxic release. Confirm prevention layers (containment, drainage, isolation) and maintenance/testing of safeguards.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Loss of utilities can create unsafe states. Confirm redundancy, safe shutdown capability, and emergency power where consequences are high.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Major losses are typically process-driven; still confirm site-specific hazard exposure and resilience of utilities and containment.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Emergency planning should address leak isolation, spill response, safe shutdown, and recovery sequencing, including competence across shifts.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Electrical assembly/testing depends on stable power and controlled environments. Power quality, humidity control, and clean electrical rooms reduce failures and rework.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Test rigs and production tooling can be bottlenecks. Confirm maintenance, calibration, spares, and program backups for fast recovery.

process_control_and_stability.help_text: Contamination control and disciplined process steps prevent latent defects. Confirm housekeeping, ESD controls, and controlled storage/handling where applicable.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Water ingress and humidity after storms/floods can cause widespread damage to sensitive components. Confirm building envelope resilience and response plans.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Recovery often depends on restoring power and clean conditions. Confirm restart procedures and protection of critical documentation/programs.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Expanded plastics/rubber operations can have high fire load and rapid fire spread potential. Housekeeping, ignition control, and effective protection/segregation are key.

process_control_and_stability.help_text: Combustible residues and deposits can accumulate; proactive cleaning and control of hot surfaces reduce ignition likelihood.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Electrical faults are common ignition sources in high-dust/high-residue areas. Confirm inspection and suitable equipment for the environment.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Presses/mixers/foaming equipment are critical. Failures can cause extended downtime and may initiate fires.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Flood/collapse can contaminate stock and create difficult recovery conditions. Confirm resilience and response planning.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Power loss can cause rapid spoilage and loss of refrigeration. Confirm backup power, fuel logistics, and restoration plans.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Flooding and severe weather can cause contamination and total product loss even with limited structural damage. Confirm resilience and response.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Bottleneck assets (refrigeration, ovens, cookers, packaging lines) drive downtime. Confirm maintenance, spares, and restart procedures.

process_control_and_stability.help_text: Process stability and hygiene controls prevent contamination and unsafe temperature excursions. Confirm monitoring, alarms, and operator response.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Fire can cause disproportionate contamination/smoke damage. Control ignition sources and maintain effective suppression to limit smoke spread and downtime.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Continuity planning should address product protection/relocation, cold-chain continuity, and recovery under reduced staffing/access constraints.

high_energy_materials_control.help_text: Molten metal handling creates extreme escalation potential, especially with refractory degradation or water contact. Confirm containment, spill routes, and keeping molten areas dry.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Utilities/power support safe control and shutdown. Confirm redundancy, emergency power, and monitored cooling where required.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Furnaces, presses, and cranes are critical. Failures can cause severe damage and prolonged outage; confirm inspection and condition monitoring.

flammable_liquids_and_fire_risk.help_text: Hydraulics/lubricants near hot operations can create severe fires. Confirm leak control and suitable local protection/segregation.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Emergency procedures should address molten spills, power loss, and recovery with spare parts/refractory and trained response across shifts.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Natural hazards can trigger utility loss and water ingress, which may escalate into molten incidents. Confirm resilience and response capability.

high_energy_materials_control.help_text: Continuous molten glass processes can suffer severe damage during uncontrolled shutdowns or containment failures. Confirm refractory monitoring and containment.

electrical_and_utilities_reliability.help_text: Reliable power/utilities are essential for safe shutdown and process control. Confirm emergency arrangements and orderly shutdown capability.

critical_equipment_reliability.help_text: Melters, cooling, forming, and control systems are highly interdependent. Confirm monitoring, maintenance, and spare strategy for bottlenecks.

emergency_response_and_bcp.help_text: Emergency response should address leaks, safe shutdown, and recovery sequencing including availability of repair materials and trained staff.

natural_hazard_exposure_and_controls.help_text: Losses are usually process-driven; still confirm site-specific exposure and utility resilience.
